Average vietnamese food, had a bowl of rare beef pho ad fried spring rolls.  Good service, but unfortunately just average when compared to other Vietnamese restaurants in SF.  There wasn't even any sliced onions in my pho.  Pretty plain jane.

Staff told me they named it after the Vietnamese Coriander leaf called "laksa".  After looking it up, that's only part of it's formal name, daun laksa.  In Vietnamese it's called rau răm.  Hope no Malays get offended, there is no authentic laksa on the menu as others have stated.
author: Kevin H.

description: We love Laksa and eat there 1-2 times a week (we both eat there and take out). It's the perfect spot to get good affordable food. The owners are incredibly nice and always greet us with a smile. We've ordered just about everything on the menu and everything is tasty. Laksa is the perfect addition to the neighborhood allowing for a place that is more on the affordable side.
author: F J.

description: This place is Vietnamese, even though the name is Malay, and serves phô and bùn and rice plates.  We wandered in for a late lunch.  It was a hot day, so I got a salted plum soda, and we split the papaya salad with tofu and bùn with grilled shrimp and imperial rolls.  Everything was pretty good.  The imperial rolls were crispy with rice wrappers not egg, and the plum soda properly salty and sweet.   Good solid spot for lunch.
author: Nicole B.

description: I found this place right by my house in noe valley and was seriously a hidden gem. You have to try the 5 spice chicken with the garlic noodles super good the staff is also very nice as well gives me a home welcoming feeling and the music is great.
author: Frank L.

description:
First I am Vietnamese and I have tasted homemade Viet food and I have ate at a lot of Vietnamese restaurants. 

Service: The as we entered no one had sat us down. There were only 3-4 people at that time eating. But no waiters. The dish cleaner had to sit us down. Then when the waiters came out, they noticed us and gave us the menu. I noticed that for a Vietnamese restaurant, none of them spoke Viet. They ARE nice but they were slow and also on their phones a majority of the time. 

Food: Food was sub-par. Compared to other Vietnamese restaurants, it lacked taste. The garlic noodle was bland. The beef was chewy. The pork was the best out of the food in a bad way. We didn't get the pho but realized it wasn't worth trying. 

Find a better place.
author: John P.

description:
TL;DR The best pho place in the mission; visited 3 times now since the grand opening. The staff is really responsive and friendly and make you want to come back all the time. Which is easy, given that I love pho and live in the mission and it's the best place that's nearby.

Longer / honest feedback:

1. Their broth is really good. By the end of your meal when the broth is losing heat, you don't see egregious fat separation (which you find in bad pho).

2. Their noodles are really good too. Springy and fresh tasting vs lesser places where it might fall apart quickly.

3. Portion sizes are what you'd expect. I always ask for extra noodles / perhaps extra meat depending on how I'm feeling, and it's probably the same as an "extra large" at a lot of places. They don't have an explicit "large vs normal" sizing on the menu, so if you're a big eater be sure to ask for extras. Or you can also ask for more after you finish what's in the bowl; service here is great.

4. Their 3-color drink (Chè) is great! Minor nitpick is it'd be easier to drink with a thick boba straw (vs the normal plastic straw they provide) -- alternatively if the ice were crushed to small pieces then I could easily use my spoon to scoop the yummy things at the bottom. I love that every pho place does it a little differently: if you're curious their "3 colors" seem to be a white coconut milk + clear jelly + other stuff layer, red bean, and green (mung) bean.

5. I really wish they had a tendon option for their pho. Tendon is one of my favorite parts and they just don't offer it. Which is fine considering they get everything else right, but maybe someday they'll have it! :D
author: Sam L.

description: The 2 stars is mostly for the bad customer service. My mother and I came in today around 1pm to have some pho. We walked in and the waitress signaled with a finger and a grunt to a table. The place was fairly empty, with only about 1-2 other customers  and after being ignored for about 20 minutes the waitress came. I tried being as kind as possible and kept our order simple. She wordlessly took our order and went to the back. When she came back (not even a few seconds later after we ordered) I asked if it would be too late to change 1 of the orders to which she rolled her eyes. She came back with our pho, again, without a word just nasty looks. The pho was average, a bit bland but fresh. After we finished, I went to go pay and still decided to leave a tip despite the bad service. She yanked the money out of my hand and tossed it under the desk without looking at me. I thanked her for the meal as I was leaving and she didn't even bother to look our way. Overall, I don't think we'll be returning.
author: Rubii N.

description: Had the coconut curry noodles. They were meh. I wouldn't have finished them if I hadn't skipped dinner the evening before. Definitely enjoyed Mau much more.
author: Risako O.

description: A little pho place that opened up closer to 24th is a godsend on rainy nights but unfortunately laksa is just okay. The broth is thin but the noodles are decent and service is excellent. I would come back just for the five spice chicken though which was good. Maybe garlic noodles next time.
author: Rohan D.

description: The look and feel of Laksa is very chic and modern. The customer service is excellent and the owner makes sure every customer is treated equal. The food was great and you can't beat the price. It's a must eat! Enjoy!
author: Saea E.

description: I live around the corner from this spot. Love it! Great addition to the neighborhood for affordable food. I always go for the Pho. But have had other dishes that have also been great.
author: Brian S.

description: We were seated quickly on a Saturday night. Good customer service and the food was delicious. Definitely recommend the imperial roll and chicken garlic noodles. Great size plate and tastes amazing.
author: Michelle H.

description: Been there quite a few times.  The garlic green beans and the char broiled beef with garlic noodles are a must have.  Frankly i would have given 5 stars if not for the fact that when i paid in cash I didn't get my change back, which was like a 25% tip for them.  Tacky.  I will be back and deduct it from my next tip.
author: Tony V.

description:
Meat was mostly fat :(
Good sized portions though and not expensive

Update: downing to one star, massive stomachache :(
author: B H.

description: I had the combo beef pho plus a side of imperial rolls and it was just ok.  The broth was seasoned just right but all the beef they added (steak, brisket and meatballs) were just too bland -- had to dip them in soy sauce just to have some flavor.  Their pho bowls are huge so I reckon it could be split for 2 people.  The imperial rolls were just average as well but I appreciate the fact that they weren't greasy.
author: Janis P.

description: Order take out via delivery and am always satisfied. Love their garlic noodles, 5 spice chicken, pork and imperial rolls. Always timely and food is delicious.
author: Demetri A.

description: Laksa has been a fantastic addition to the neighborhood. A quick, affordable, and delicious meal with great service. They make you feel like family when you eat in at their restaurant. Favorites are: garlic noodles, imperial rolls, shrimp, thai ice tea.
author: Erica B.

description:
After reading the reviews I was excited to receive my delivery for myself and a child I was caring for. As we sat down to eat within 2 minutes our food was cold and I had to reheat it. 

The loft is only 15 minutes away from the restaurant. I don't believe food that was "hot" can get cold so easily. 

Luckily the child was engaged in an activity that she did not realize I had to reheat it.

I gave the food an extra star because of the flavor and delivery time (45-50 min). Maybe it would of been hotter if we went into the restaurant.
author: Kristen S.

description: I tried this place a few months ago when they first opened in my neighborhood. Their garlic noodles were ok, but all the other dishes were greasy and tasteless. We decided to give it another go now, after seeing some positive reviews. It was about 8:30pm on a Sunday night. They are supposed to close at 9:30. We tried calling to order pickup, but they didn't answer. So we walked over there to see maybe they were too busy to answer the phone. They were not busy at all. They had only one or two tables occupied. But they had a sign at the door saying that they closed early because they ran out of ingredients. Seriously? Well at least they could have answered their phone to let us know this so that we would not waste our time. I doubt that I will try going there again.
author: J S.

description: The garlic noods are my favorite. All the noods here are pretty good. I usually order takeout but the crowds in the restaurant aren't too bad.
author: Jaden M.

description: Laksa is my go to in this neighborhood. Fast, friendly service with great flavorful food. Decent pricing for the area. I always get their garlic noodles with beef, and beef fresh spring rolls.
author: G S.

description: I've only had food delivered.  It usually arrives earlier than expected, is fresh, tastes good! Nice portions, reasonable prices!
author: Monte C.

description:
New and outstanding! 
My boyfriend and I stopped by to have lunch and we were satisfied. We ordered the Imperial rolls, and Fresh spring rolls, they both were extremely fresh and delicious. Pork Vermicelli was also succulent and outstanding. The ambiance and the service were great. It was lunch time so there were plenty of parking spot. Definitely I'm coming back!
author: Ginna R.

description: I got the beef pho and it wasn't bad but there wasn't anything spectacular about it either. The noodles and broth were alright but the beef was lacking flavor. Aside from that, there wasn't much else there - no diced spring onions, no parsley, no chilli flakes and no slice of lime. There were bean sprouts because I forgot to tell them to not put any in (I hate bean sprouts). All in all, the food wasn't bad for the price and it was served soon after ordering so it gets three stars.
author: Adam F.

description:
Love the beef pho soooo much. First time try it, but will next! 
Five-spice chicken is also my favourite. Really really flavorful!
Overall, love the tasty Vietnamese food!
author: Lawrence S.

description: Very average pho. As a pho-natic it's all about the broth. That being said, it was a very salty and not very flavorful. Also real skimpy on meat. Had the beef combo and there was no tripe or tendon.
author: Robert P.

description: Ordered delivery via Eat24 from here yesterday.  I really wanted like this place, as pho delivery options in SF are scarce.  Unfortunately, I will have to echo the opinion of the other yelpers.  The pho broth was like water, it had zero depth and I had to dump in all the sauces/condiments just to give this some flavor.
author: Clarissa P.

description: Nice place. Good food. Friendly service. I'm slightly confused about the name "Laksa" since there's no laksa on the menu
author: Robert K.

description: Ordered beef pho, the soup tasted so good! Out of my expectation!
author: S K.

description: I love this place. The pho vegetarian soup is the best I have ever tasted. They are not stingy with the vegetables like some places and the food just tastes clean. Also a plus that it's so affordable for a decent meal especially in SF. Been here a few times and also ordered online, the staff are great & attentive.
author: Maria W.

description:
First, the name of the restaurant is misleading. Laksa is one of the national Malaysian/Singaporean soup noodle dish and this restaurant is neither and serves only Vietnamese food.  

My instinct tells me that whomever opened this restaurant has no idea what the name really means and if he/she was Vietnamese, they would know that Laksa is not even a Vietnamese dish.

Suspicion aside, I decided to give it a try.  Name is afterall just a name.  So, the pho is only OK and may satisfy neighborhood patrons who do not want to travel out of the neighborhood.  But, definitely not a restaurant to go to, if you are a foodie.
author: Mit T.

description: Pho was good and warm, and the broth isn't too salty. The spring rolls are a little noodle heavy and protein light. Prices are good!
author: Maureen L.

description: The rating of this place really confused me.. Originally my girlfriend and I went inside to eat in -- but the smell in there was terrible, like wet dog and feet... so my girlfriend and I decided to try taking it to go instead (we were really craving pho). Much to our disappointment, the repugnant smell is in the food too, with no good flavor to boot.. quite unfortunate. I wish it was just bland, but it was worse than that.
author: Ian B.

description:
I never though I'd be leaving 5 stars for a Vietnamese restaurant but this place deserves it. Prices are very reasonable and the food was delicious. The portion sizes are perfect. The environment is modern.  I had the garlic noodle with five spice chicken. Will definitely be coming back to try other items.

This was the second day they they are open.
author: Vance K.

description: We went to Laksa yesterday and it was really a good experience. I ordered veg garlic noodles and they came with a side off silver noodles in bed of veggies. The garlic noodles were really nice as well.
author: Rohit N.

description: I ordered this delivery with postmates, and it was some of the worst pho I have had in a really long time. There was no depth of flavor in the broth and it had an even sour taste that was really unenjoyable. I also love to put chili oil in my pho which they claim to not have. The meet quality also seemed very low. I will say the noodles were fresh and cooked perfectly, but the noodles are the least of my pho concerns.
author: Kessa P.

description: I order delivery from here, and repeatedly do so because it's fast, convenient and they open all day (so I don't have to worry about closures btn 3-5pm).  I've tried most items on the menu and it's all okay!  Garlic noodles are probably the most repeated order for us, generally we get it with the chicken.  The pork and beef often times are too charred.  Papaya salad, their take is a finely shredded green papaya and the dressing tastes like a simple fish sauce / sugar mixture. Curry chicken noodles, I find the soup to be too soupy and comes with too little chicken.  Imperial rolls have taro in it, which I like!  I have yet to try the pho, but probably will go to the restaurant for that instead of delivery.
author: Ames L.

description: This is a solid place to get Pho.  There's never been a wait and the tables are clean.  It's a pretty large portion at a fair price even for SF and the service is good.  I've gotten lucky finding street parking nearby.  I've definitely decided to make this my go-to place for pho in the city.
author: george c.

description: Awesome place!!! Such friendly staff! :) Jenny, the owner is easy going and has a great presence. The food is great too!
author: Ryan H.

description: Total thumbs up.  I had the garlic noodles with pork & imperial roll, and it was delicious.  I also sampled my friend's shrimp w/garlic noodles (yummy) and my husband's bun (not bad).  The noodles were flavorful and not overly greasy like they can be at other places.  And great prices for the neighborhood.  We will be back!
author: Melinda C.

description: Went to Laksa for lunch with my coworkers. Had the five spice chicken with garlic noodles. It was very tasty. Sautéed string bean is good as well. Reasonable price in the area. Service is good.
author: Kenny K.

description:
I came here with some friends. We had two orders of garlic noodles and spring rolls . Yummy! They were extremely garlic-y, which I loved, but I would have liked it a little saltier. The beef and chicken were delicious!

Overall, I really enjoyed Laksa.
author: Lili L.

description: wow!  so excited to see this space finally open!  stopped in for lunch and it was great!  a perfect addition to the neighborhood, very reasonable prices, great choice of dishes and the staff is super nice!   had the garlic noodles/five spice chicken and the garlic noodles/shrimp.....both had great flavor!   can't wait to go back!  glad they chose this location!
author: Ken B.

description: I really don't get all the hype here. I had the pho and it was the blandest pho broth I've ever had -- virtually flavorless. They didn't give much beef either. The service was fine, everything else was okay -- but man, the pho was BORING.
author: Mortimer G.

description: I've only ordered delivery from them but they won't disappoint. Pretty fast delivery and food is still warm. The pho and spring rolls are my go to. Great service and fast.
author: Gia C.

description: I love this place. The garlic noodles with pork is amazing. I live up the street and have ordered from here about 5 times so far. Every time has been great. This place doesn't try to be fancy or trendy. Just good food at reasonable prices
author: Jordan B.

description: Finally, some decent Vietnamese cuisine in this part of town without Valencia Street pricing.
author: Ken C.

description: The five spice chicken is out of this world.  The beef pho portion was kind of small. I ate here 3 times and the food here hasn't disappointed me once.
author: Dennis T.

description: Gluten free pho! All but two of the pho options are gluten free and celiac safe. Lots of gluten free appetizers. Great service.
author: Kelly G.

description: Delicious garlic noodles, great pork chop, super nice guy behind the counter!
author: Nonada R.

description: A great addition to the neighborhood and very reasonably priced.  The lemongrass pork and beef are both solid.  The garlic noodles could use a bit more oomph (I'm not looking for Perilla levels of garlic, but a bit more would be nice).  I'll be going here for takeout regularly.
author: David G.

description: Meatballs in the pho were the best I've ever had but the broth didn't have tons of dimension. Still solid pho though.
author: Erin W.

description: Bomb ass garlic noodles and the service was quick and friendly. Pork chops are hella good!
author: Lester I.

description: Ordered for take-out. Green beans were deliiicious. Service and processes were clumsy and disorganized.
author: Rumana H.

description: Ordered the Pho Ga so you don't have to. The Imperial Roll was good but pass on the Pho Ga
author: William J.

description: So sad this is bad review, as this was my place to go for cheap good food. Unfortunately, and yes I should have written this a few months ago, I decided to stop going there. Reason you ask? Well, I am a dog lover. But the owner, decided to go pet a random dog outside the restaurant, which is fine. She then came back in, and started to put out more non covered with paper  chopsticks on the tables, WITHOUT WASHING HER HANDS. Now that is just plain disgusting. Totally lost my appetite there and then.You ask why did I not say something to her? Well, it is not my job to tell her to ways her hands when handling people's utensils. If she is like that how is the rest of the restaurant. And when we used to go with my bf, they would only remember him, because of his weight, really calling him fat and saying that is why they remember us??? He is not over weight. And then when I went to pick up food (way before not washing of hands incident), from eat 24 and getting mad that, saying they never got the other, but they acknowledge it on the app. So I had to wait another 25 minutes for me food. Which they handed in a rough manner. I let that good, but if you are not clean I am not coming back.
author: Sheyla A.

description:
Um went is this place called laksa when there isn't a single laksa dish on the menu?! 

I was so excited. I come from the land of laksa (Malaysia) and thought finally someone opened a laksa place. This is a Vietnamese pho joint. Nothing wrong with Vietnamese pho. Just don't call there place laksa unless you actually serve laksa.
author: Yen P.

description:
Great food - huge pho fan. 
Friendly service - the owners are super sweet and funny. 
Very affordable - great value in an area where there are very few cheap options.
author: Chris H.

description: I was excited to see a Vietnamese place open in our neighborhood (although the name "Laksa" is misleading).  I like to support neighborhood spots, but unfortunately our meal was not good and we will not be going back.  The pho broth was flavorless and the noddles were overcooked.  We also ordered the side dish of vegetables and it was 90% cabbage with a few carrots and chunks of tofu.  Imperial rolls were meh.  There's much better Vietnamese food in the city.
author: Kim M.

description: I had pho that's a lot less greasy and less sweet than other places, which I like a lot. The egg rolls were also very good especially wrapped with lettuce. I will definitely go back to try their garlic noodles and other food and drinks.
author: Jane X.

description: Had my dinner at around 6. Not too crowded but people start coming in at 6:30. I had pork chops garlic noodle, imperial rolls, green beans, and thai ice tea. Amazingly delicious. Garlic noodles are not too buttery or oily. The size of the garlic noodles and pork chops are huge. The price is considered cheap compared to other places. I would definitely come back and recommend this place to friends and family.  You should give this place a try if you're around the area. Yumm!!!
author: Lan L.

description: Finally, a neighborhood restaurant with great food, great prices, and friendly staff. The garlic noodles and shrimp are perfection. Pho on a cold day? Yes, please. You get a massive bowl that's filling and yummy, not to mention cheap. We love Laksa!
author: Rob R.

description: Worst place ever.  Took 90 minutes to get our food and the Pho was ice cold.  Go someplace else.
author: Pamela G.

description: This was good pho but I was a little surprised by the high rating. I thought it was solid but nothing incredible. I got the chicken curry pho and spring rolls, maybe I'll have to try something different next time!
author: Rohan S.

description: UPDATED sept 7 i'm so glad I came back. The food was delicious and this time I ate at the restaurant. So glad it's in the neighborhood.
author: JEFF B.

description: i really like this place. fast delivery and the food is good too. the staff is friendly.
author: Vicky L.

description: The Pho broth was bland, and lacked animal fat that one ordinarliy finds in broths. The spring rolls were mediocre and contained way to many rice noodles.
author: Siren S.

description: So glad to have great Pho in the neighborhood.  Had the Rare Beef Pho which was fantastic.  The Imperial Rolls were also delicious.  Food was ready quickly and everything was inexpensive by Mission standards.
author: brian m.
